definition: Yunnan, Guizhou and Sichuan
cloud/CL:朵[duo3]
(classical) to say
surname Yun/abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南省|云南省[Yun2 nan2 Sheng3]
expensive/noble/precious/(honorific) your
abbr. for Sichuan Province 四川[Si4 chuan1] in southwest China
river/creek/plain/an area of level country

sentences.english: In my opinion Yunnan, Guizhou and Sichuan are all in danger, let alone Hainan.
sentences.chinese: 我看云贵川都有危险，海南更不用说了。

definition: Yunnan province in southwest China, bordering on Vietnam, Laos and Myanmar, abbr. 滇[dian1] or 雲|云, capital Kunming 昆明
Guizhou province (Kweichow) in south central China, abbr. to 黔[Qian2] or 貴|贵[Gui4], capital Guiyang 貴陽|贵阳[Gui4 yang2]
the two provinces of Guangdong and Guangxi (traditional)
Gansu province, abbr. 甘[Gan1], short name 隴|陇[Long3], capital Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1]
Shaanxi and Gansu provinces
Shaanxi, Gansu and Ningxia provinces
Inner Mongolia or Inner Mongolia autonomous region 內蒙古自治區|内蒙古自治区[Nei4 meng3 gu3 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]
Hunan-Guizhou
Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region 廣西壯族自治區|广西壮族自治区 in South Central China, on the border with Vietnam, abbr. 桂, capital Nanning 南寧|南宁/until 1959, Guangxi province
Yunnan and Guizhou plateau in southwest China, covering east Yunnan, whole of Guizhou, west of Guangxi and southern margins of Sichuan, Hubei and Hunan
abbr. for Yunnan Province 雲南|云南[Yun2 nan2] in southwest China
Qinghai province (Tsinghai) in west China, abbr. 青, capital Xining 西寧|西宁
Xiangxi Tujia and Miao Autonomous Prefecture 湘西土家族苗族自治州[Xiang1 xi1 Tu3 jia1 zu2 Miao2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1]/western Hunan
abbr. for Guizhou province 貴州|贵州[Gui4 zhou1]
Western Sichuan
Sichuan province (Szechuan) in southwest China, abbr. 川 or 蜀, capital Chengdu 成都
